intro: Aplocarya divaricata, commonly known as the variegated liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its small, closely packed leaves that form a dense mat on the soil surface. The plant exhibits a distinctive pattern of green and yellowish-green coloration due to the presence of chlorophyll and other pigments. Aplocarya divaricata thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or rocky crevices. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small invertebrates.
